etymology.description: 垚(垚) (yáo, "tall of earth") + 兀(兀) (wù, "towering and bald") = phonetic tall with semantic towering -> high
etymology.interpretation: 堯(堯) (yáo, "high") combines 垚(垚) (yáo) and 兀(兀) (wù) to signify something tall and prominent, reflective of its meaning 'high'. The ancient depiction included elements representing a structure rising from the earth, emphasizing elevation.
etymology.simplification: In Japanese shinjitai, 垚(垚) was replaced with 卉(卉) to form the simplified character 尧.

examples.chinese: 他梦想登上尭峰(他夢想登上尭峰)，俯瞰万里江山(俯瞰萬里江山)。
examples.pinyin: Tā mèngxiǎng dēng shàng yáofēng, fǔkàn wànlǐ jiāngshān.
examples.english: He dreams of climbing the lofty peak and overlooking the vast country.

examples.chinese: 这座山峰巍然耸立(這座山峰巍然聳立)，顶峰尭峙(頂峰尭峙)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zuò shānfēng wēirán sǒnglì, dǐngfēng yáozhì.
examples.english: This mountain rises majestically, its peak stands high.
